message.say: Mr. Johnson only has an hour to work out every day and he wants to burn more calorie.

message.name: A210
message.say: , which highlighted sentence could help him choose the best exercise to help him lose weight?

message.name: A211
message.say: To answer this, we need to find the sentence that describes the difference between running and walking in terms of calorie consumption.

message.name: A212
message.say: We need to find a sentence that compares walking to running and tells us which burns more calories in the same amount of time.

message.name: A213
message.say: In the third answer option, you will find that running burns more calories per hour. Mr. Johnson should choose running.

message.name: A214
message.say: Running burns more calories!

message.name: A215
message.say: , which highlighted sentence could help him choose between running and walking?

message.name: A216
message.say: Notice that this sentence mentions walking is a good beginner exercise, but it does not mention that walking burns more calories than running.

message.name: A217
message.say: Please see that this is a similarity between walking and running. Mr. Johnson needs to choose one, so he needs to see a difference between the two.

message.name: A219
message.say: Walkers need to burn more calories. So what could walkers do?

message.say: If you look at the second and third sentences, you will see that the both give you information about how to burn more calories while walking.

message.name: A221
message.say: The first sentence encourages you to walk if you like it better, but it does not tell you how to achieve your weight loss goals while walking as compared to running.

message.name: A222

message.say: So, find the sentencethat tells you what to do if you are overweight and see what is less stressful, walking or running?

message.say: Walking is less stressful on the body.

message.name: A232
message.say: This sentence evaluates running and walking based on the amount of time you have and not on the amount of stress on the body.

message.say: Both walking and running can improve health. But for this question, you need to consider which one causes less stress on the body.

message.name: A414
message.say: , what should be included in a summary of a comparison text?

message.name: A415
message.say: When you are comparing and contrasting information in a text, it is important to look at both the similarities and the differences between two or more things.

message.name: A416
message.say: In order to get all the facts, both similarities and differences can be important to find.

message.name: A417
message.say: The best summaries include all the most important information. It can depend on what you want to know from the comparison, but usually you will need both the similarities and the differences.

message.name: A418
message.say: Both similarities and differences.

message.name: A419
message.say: , what should be included in a summary of a comparison text?

message.name: A420
message.say: In a summary, you want to include all of the important information.

message.name: A421
message.say: and Jordan, you do not want to limit a summary to just the differences in the comparison.
